revised_title: Water Balance and Desiccation Resistance in Tsetse Pupae
tldr: This study investigates the water balance and desiccation resistance of tsetse pupae, focusing on Glossina morsitans Westwood. The research explores the different stages of pupal development and how tsetse pupae can withstand adverse conditions. The findings show that tsetse pupae have a high resistance to desiccation, which allows them to complete development in low humidity environments. This resistance is due to a decrease in the permeability of the puparium and pupal skin, a reduction in the size of respiratory lobes, and an increase in the percentage of water loss that can be tolerated before development stops.
